data.title: Meridian Announces Upsize of Non-Brokered Private Placement to up to CAD 17 Million
data.description:
NOT FOR DISTRIBUTION TO UNITED STATES NEWSWIRE SERVICES OR FOR DISSEMINATION IN THE UNITED STATES

LONDON, UK / ACCESS Newswire / February 4, 2025 / Meridian Mining UK S (Frankfurt/Tradegate:2MM)(OTCQX:MRRDF) ("Meridian" or the "Company") is pleased to announce that due to substantial interest, the non-brokered private placement of common shares (the "Common Shares") at CAD 0.39 per Common Share, announced on January 28, 2025, has been increased from CAD 10M to CAD 17M (the "Private Placement").

Pursuant to the Private Placement, the Company proposes to issue up to 43,589,744 Common Shares for gross proceeds of up to CAD 17,000,000. The net proceeds from the Private Placement are expected to be used in advancing the Cabaçal's PFS, initiate the FS and related programs as well as associated resource and exploration activities of the broader Cabaçal Au-Cu-Ag VMS belt, regional targeting, and for working capital and general corporate purposes. Finder's Fees may be payable on a portion of the Private Placement.

The Private Placement is expected to close during the week of February 17, 2025, and is subject to certain conditions including, but not limited to, the receipt of all necessary regulatory and other approvals, including the acceptance of the Toronto Stock Exchange.

Securities to be issued pursuant to the Private Placement will be subject to a four-month hold period under applicable securities laws in Canada.

This news release does not constitute an offer to sell or a solicitation of an offer to buy nor shall there be any sale of any of the securities in any jurisdiction in which such offer, solicitation or sale would be unlawful. The securities have not been and will not be registered under the United States Securities Act of 1933, as amended (the "U.S. Securities Act"), or the securities laws of any state of the United States and may not be offered or sold within the United States (as defined in Regulation S under the U.S. Securities Act) unless registered under the U.S. Securities Act and applicable state securities laws or pursuant to an exemption from such registration requirements.

About Meridian

Meridian Mining is focused on:

  • The development and exploration of the advanced stage Cabaçal VMS gold‐copper project;

  • The initial resource definition at the second higher-grade VMS asset at Santa Helena as the first stage of the Cabaçal Hub development strategy;

  • Regional scale exploration of the Cabaçal VMS belt to expand the Cabaçal Hub strategy; and

  • Exploration in the Jaurú & Araputanga Greenstone belts (the above all located in the State of Mato Grosso, Brazil).

The Preliminary Economic Assessment technical report (the "PEA Technical Report") dated March 30, 2023, entitled: "Cabaçal Gold-Copper Project NI 43-101 Technical Report and Preliminary Economic Assessment, Mato Grosso, Brazil" outlines a base case after-tax NPV5 of USD 573 million and 58.4% IRR ("Table 1") from a pre-production capital cost of USD 180 million, leading to capital repayment in 10.6 months (assuming metals price scenario of USD 1,650 per ounces of gold, USD 3.59 per pound of copper, and USD 21.35 per ounce of silver). Cabaçal has a low All-in-Sustaining-Cost of USD 671 per ounce gold equivalent for the first five years, driven by high metallurgical recovery, a low life-of-mine strip ratio of 2.1:1, and the low operating cost environment of Brazil.

The Cabaçal Mineral Resource estimate consists of Indicated resources of 52.9 million tonnes at 0.6g/t gold, 0.3% copper and 1.4g/t silver and Inferred resources of 10.3 million tonnes at 0.7g/t gold, 0.2% copper & 1.1g/t silver (at a 0.3 g/t gold equivalent cut-off grade).

Readers are encouraged to read the PEA Technical Report in its entirety. The PEA Technical Report may be found on the Company's website at www.meridianmining.co and under the Company's profile on SEDAR+ at www.sedarplus.ca.

data.title: Biosergen Completes Second Patient Cohort in Antifungal Drug's Proof-of-Concept Study
data.description:
Biosergen on Tuesday noted "compelling proof-of-concept data" for its BSG005 antifungal drug candidate after completing treatment for a second cohort of patients.

A third cohort is planned for the fourth quarter as cohort 2 resulted in higher-than-planned usage of BSG005, which means the clinical-stage biotechnology company will need to replenish its supply.

The second cohort of five patients with life-threatening fungal infections ended with one recovery, three significant improvements and a withdrawal due to discomfort.

data.title: Fabrinet SEC 10-Q Report
data.description:
Fabrinet, a leading provider of advanced optical packaging and precision optical, electro-mechanical, and electronic manufacturing services, has released its latest Form 10-Q report, showcasing robust financial and operational performance for the quarter ended December 27, 2024. The report highlights significant growth in revenue and profitability, driven by strong demand across multiple geographic regions and effective cost management strategies.

Financial Highlights

Fabrinet reported impressive financial results for the quarter, reflecting its strong market position and operational efficiency:

  • Revenues: $833.6 million, a substantial increase from $712.7 million in the same quarter last year, driven by strong demand across multiple geographic regions.
  • Gross Profit: $100.8 million, up from $88.3 million, indicating improved efficiency and cost management.
  • Operating Income: $79.6 million, compared to $69.0 million in the prior year, showcasing effective control over operating expenses.
  • Net Income: $86.6 million, an increase from $69.1 million, highlighting strong overall financial performance.
  • Basic EPS: $2.40, up from $1.90, reflecting the company's ability to generate higher earnings per share.
  • Diluted EPS: $2.38, compared to $1.89, indicating improved profitability on a per-share basis.

Business Highlights

Fabrinet's business performance for the quarter was marked by strong demand across its key segments and regions:

  • Revenue Segments: The company reported that 77.6% of its revenue for the three months ended December 27, 2024, came from optical communications, with datacom and telecom contributing significantly. Non-optical communications, including automotive and industrial lasers, accounted for 22.4% of the revenue.
  • Geographical Performance: For the three months ended December 27, 2024, 44.7% of the company's revenue was generated from North America, 47.3% from Asia-Pacific and others, and 8.0% from Europe. The increase in North American revenue was primarily due to higher sales to a customer in the United States.
  • Geographical Performance: The percentage of revenue from regions outside North America decreased to 55.3% in the three months ended December 27, 2024, compared to 66.1% in the same period the previous year, indicating a shift towards more revenue being generated from North America.
  • Future Outlook: The company expects the portion of future revenues attributable to customers in regions outside North America for the remainder of fiscal year 2025 to be in line with the portion of revenues during the six months ended December 27, 2024.
  • Operational Challenges: The company anticipates continued disruptions in its supply chain and fluctuations in the availability of parts and materials, which may adversely impact revenue generation despite strong customer demand.
  • Operational Challenges: The company is experiencing a near-term inventory correction among its optical communications customers, which is expected to persist and impact revenue generation.
  • Employee Costs: The company expects employee costs to increase in Thailand and the PRC due to rising wages, which may impact its competitive advantage and profit margins.
  • Expansion Plans: The company plans to expand its manufacturing capacity into new geographic markets, which is expected to incur incremental costs of revenue.
  • Foreign Exchange Impact: The company is exposed to foreign exchange risk, primarily with respect to the Thai baht, and uses derivative instruments to manage these risks. The appreciation of the Thai baht against the U.S. dollar could negatively impact financial results.
  • Contracts and Supply Agreements: The company enters into supply agreements with customers that typically have an initial term of up to three years, with automatic renewals. These agreements include provisions for pricing, consignment of production equipment, and cost-saving benefit sharing.

data.title: Earnings Flash (CRVL) CorVel Posts Fiscal Q3 Revenue $228 Million
U.K. Grocery Inflation Slows as Supermarkets Bet on Discounts, Report Says
data.description:
By Michael Susin

U.K. grocery inflation fell in January as intense promotional activity provided some relief for budget-pressured households.

Annual grocery inflation fell to 3.3% for the four weeks to Jan. 26 compared with the previous year. This followed 3.7% grocery inflation recorded in December, according to the latest report from research firm Kantar.

Kantar said take-home grocery sales rose by 4.3% on year, and nearly one third of this spending was on promotions.

Consumers are also ditching brand names and prioritizing keeping costs down, with private-label sales proportionally reaching a record high of more than half of sales in January.

Following the Christmas festivities and related excesses, January's sales were also marked by an increase in wellness trends, with more than 10% of the average consumer's bill spent on fresh staples such as fruit, vegetables and salad.

Sales of low-and-no alcohol drinks were 7% higher than the same period a year prior, as the "dry January" trend becomes increasingly popular among older shoppers.

Among the top-performing grocers over the 12 weeks to Jan. 26, sales of the German discounter Lidl rose 7.4% and reached three consecutive years of growth, holding a market share of 7.2%.

Online retailer Ocado was the fastest-growing grocer for the ninth consecutive month, with sales up 11.3% and a 1.9% market share.

The U.K.'s largest grocer, Tesco, achieved a market share of 28.5% and saw a 5.6% rise in sales.

Write to Michael Susin at michael.susin@wsj.com

data.title: Centene 4Q Revenue Grows at Higher Clip Than Wall Street Predicted
data.description:
By Denny Jacob

Centene posted higher fourth-quarter revenue than a year earlier, with results coming in above what Wall Street had forecast.

The St. Louis health insurer logged earnings of $283 million, or 56 cents a share, up from $45 million, or 8 cents a share, a year earlier.

Stripping out certain one-time items, earnings came in at 80 cents a share. Analysts polled by FactSet expected 49 cents a share.

Revenue rose to $40.81 billion from $39.46 billion. Analysts polled by FactSet expected $39.36 billion.

Centene said premium and services revenues increased 3% to $36.3 billion, driven primarily by Medicaid rate increases and membership growth.

Write to Denny Jacob at denny.jacob@wsj.com

data.title: Emirati Stocks Close Higher as Global Investors Weigh Looming Trade War
data.description:
Markets in the United Arab Emirates were in the green on Tuesday's close, with investors treading cautiously amid escalating trade tensions between the world's two largest economies.

At close of trading, the FTSE ADX General Index increased 0.091%, while the DFM General Index added 0.701%.

US President Donald Trump's 10% duty on Chinese goods prompted Beijing to retaliate with targeted tariffs on US goods, with several US companies now under scrutiny for potential sanctions, Reuters reported. Analysts flagged concerns over Trump's broader tariff measures on Canada, Mexico, and China, warning of their impact on US economic growth.

"The increase in China tariffs alone makes this the biggest single tariff increase Trump has enacted in either of his presidential terms. If these tariffs fully take effect, their size will dwarf the entirety of the tariffs Trump imposed during his first term in office," Nomura Global Markets Research said in a note. "Higher tariffs are likely to push up core inflation meaningfully, which reinforces our Fed call of no rate cuts this year," analysts added.

Back in the UAE, Borouge (ADX:BOROUGE) posted an increase in attributable profit for full-year 2024, while revenue jumped year over year. The Abu Dhabi-listed petrochemicals company rose 0.394%.

Meanwhile, tech-focused investor Multiply Group (ADX:MULTIPLY) closed 0.939% in the red after it swung to a loss in full-year 2024. Revenue, however, surged year over year.

Elsewhere, Shuaa Capital (DFM:SHUAA) secured a favorable court ruling in a case brought by a former board member seeking 22 million Emirati dirhams in labor dues. The Dubai-listed financial services company fell 1.961%.

data.title: Ghana Inflation Rate Eases for 1st Time in 5 Months
data.description:
Ghana's annual consumer inflation fell slightly to 23.5% in January 2025, down from an eight-month high of 23.8% in the prior month, marking the first decrease in five months.

Still, inflation remains well above the Bank of Ghana’s 8% target range, with a 6%-10% tolerance band.

The central bank warned recently that inflation will take longer to return to target.

Non-food inflation slowed (19.2% vs 20.3% in December), contributing to the decline, while food prices (28.3% vs 27.8%) continued to increase.

(11:25 GMT) Press Release: Graphic Packaging Holding Company Announces 10% Dividend Increase

Graphic Packaging Holding Company Announces 10% Dividend Increase

PR Newswire

ATLANTA, Feb. 4, 2025

ATLANTA, Feb. 4, 2025 /PRNewswire/ — Graphic Packaging Holding Company ("Graphic Packaging" or the "Company"), a global leader in sustainable consumer packaging, today announced that its Board of Directors voted to increase the quarterly dividend to $0.11 per share of common stock, a 10% increase from the prior quarterly dividend of $0.10. The increased dividend will be payable on April 5, 2025, to common stockholders of record at the close of business on March 15, 2025.

Michael Doss, the Company's President and CEO said, "As the last major investment of our Vision 2025 transformation program nears completion, the company's capital spending needs decline significantly. Our focus under Vision 2030 turns to strengthening and protecting our market-leading position in sustainable consumer packaging through reinvestment and tuck-under M&A, and returning excess capital to stockholders. We believe that a strong and growing dividend is appropriate capital allocation, and this increase reflects our confidence in the strength of our business model. We expect to supplement a growing dividend with opportunistic share repurchase, and to pursue an investment grade credit rating when doing so provides the greatest benefit to our stockholders."

About Graphic Packaging Holding Company

Graphic Packaging designs and produces consumer packaging made primarily from renewable or recycled materials. An industry leader in innovation, the Company is committed to reducing the environmental footprint of consumer packaging. Graphic Packaging operates a global network of design and manufacturing facilities serving the world's most widely recognized brands in food, beverage, foodservice, household, and other consumer products. Learn more at www.graphicpkg.com.

data.title: Amcor's Latest SEC 8-K Filing: Key Financial Insights and Developments
data.description:
Amcor, a global leader in responsible packaging solutions, has released its latest SEC 8-K filing, detailing the financial performance for the second quarter and first half of fiscal 2025. The report highlights the company's continued growth and strategic initiatives, including a significant merger with Berry Global.

Financial Highlights

Amcor reported net sales of $3.24 billion for the December 2024 quarter, with a GAAP net income of $163 million and GAAP diluted earnings per share (EPS) of 11.3 cents. Adjusted EBIT for the quarter was $363 million, reflecting a 5% increase on a comparable constant currency basis. For the first half of fiscal 2025, net sales were $6.59 billion, with a GAAP net income of $354 million and GAAP diluted EPS of 24.4 cents. Adjusted EBIT for the first half was $728 million, up 4% on a comparable constant currency basis.

Business and Operational Highlights

The company saw a sequential improvement in year-over-year volume growth, with net sales for the December quarter showing a 2.3% increase in volumes compared to the previous year. The Flexibles segment reported net sales of $2.51 billion for the quarter, up 1% from the previous year, driven by volume growth across key regions. The Rigid Packaging segment, however, saw a 5% decline in net sales to $730 million, primarily due to unfavorable price/mix impacts and lower raw material costs.

Strategic Initiatives and Corporate Developments

Amcor announced a highly complementary and financially compelling combination with Berry Global, expected to close by mid-2025. This merger aims to enhance the company's position in attractive categories, improve material science and innovation capabilities, and deliver significant synergies estimated at $650 million. Additionally, the Amcor Board of Directors declared a quarterly cash dividend of 12.75 cents per share, reflecting a slight increase from the previous year's 12.5 cents per share.

Management's Perspective

CEO Peter Konieczny expressed confidence in the company's performance, stating, "Amcor delivered a solid second quarter result aligned with the expectations we set out in October, giving us the confidence to again reaffirm our guidance for the fiscal year. We continued to execute well on our underlying business, delivering our fourth consecutive quarter of sequential volume improvement."

Konieczny also highlighted the strategic merger with Berry Global, emphasizing the potential for accelerated growth and significant value creation for shareholders.

Future Outlook

Amcor reaffirmed its fiscal 2025 guidance, projecting adjusted EPS of 72-76 cents per share and adjusted free cash flow of $900 million to $1 billion. The company expects leverage to be at or below 3.0x by June 30, 2025, and anticipates no material impact from exchange rate movements on reported EPS.

SEC Filing: Amcor plc [ AMCR ] - 8-K - Feb. 04, 2025

data.title: Health insurer Centene beats profit estimates on strength in commercial plans
data.description:
Centene beat Wall Street estimates for fourth-quarter profit on Tuesday, helped by strength in its commercial health insurance plans.

The company mostly focuses on government-backed Medicaid plans for low-income people, as well as income-based government-subsidized health insurance under the Affordable Care Act, also known as Obamacare.

It has relied on growth in its private plans for individuals and families as it struggles with a drop in members in its government-backed Medicaid plans for lower-income groups, and a rise in costs related to those plans after the end of a pandemic-era federal policy.

For the quarter, Centene reported a medical loss ratio — the percentage of premiums spent on medical care — of 89.6%, compared with 89.5% a year ago. Analysts on average had estimated a ratio of 89.95%, according to data compiled by LSEG.

On an adjusted basis, the health insurer reported a profit of 80 cents per share, above analysts' average estimate of 49 cents.

data.title: The 10-Point: The Wall Street Journal's Guide to the Day's Top News
data.description:
By Emma Tucker

President Trump's U-turn on some tariffs stunned markets and boardrooms across the world, underscoring his willingness to risk major economic disruptions to make a point. Just as new U.S. tariffs of 10% on China went into effect, Beijing retaliated. European leaders are prepared for their own fight with Trump over the world's most valuable trading relationship — and they prefer cooperation. And in Washington, Elon Musk's push to dismantle multiple federal agencies has lawmakers and government workers wondering who is really in charge.

Today's Headlines

China hit back against new U.S. tariffs with a series of moves including levies on certain American goods, an antitrust probe into Google and restrictions on Chinese exports of key minerals.

The White House whipsawed over the timing of tariffs and the possibility of carve-outs before striking last-minute deals with Canada and Mexico.

European leaders, bracing for a trade fight with Trump, said they are ready to strike back but prefer cooperation.

As Musk moved with Silicon Valley velocity to shake up Washington, Trump hinted that there are curbs to keep him from doing anything in the government without the White House's blessing.

Secretary of State Marco Rubio said El Salvador offered to accept deportees of any nationality from the U.S., including incarcerated American citizens.

Live From The Markets

Trump's detente with Mexico and Canada validates optimists on Wall Street, but this risks breeding complacency regarding a real trade war, writes Jon Sindreu.

Read It Here First

Amazon, king of online retail, can't seem to make its physical stores work.

The company has shrunk its portfolio of Amazon Go convenience stores by about half since early 2023, and closed dozens of its other branded retail stores in recent years, including bookstores, fashion outlets and its "4-star" locations stocked with bestselling items from its website. After a decadelong experiment with bricks-and-mortar stores, Amazon's dominance online has yet to translate into a successful strategy for connecting with shoppers in the real world, Kate King reports.

In 24 hours, one senator flipped from no to a crucial yes on Pete Hegseth.

The night before Sen. Thom Tillis cast the fateful 50th "yes" vote to confirm Hegseth as defense secretary, he approached the Senate's new Republican leader and told him he was a "no." That set off a last-minute blitz by the president, the vice president, the Republican whip team and Hegseth himself. Tillis's turnaround left witnesses who came forward as collateral damage, Lindsay Wise, Jack Gillum and Meridith McGraw report.

Expert Take

Q: Is USAID closing?

Rubio notified lawmakers Monday that he intends to work with Congress to reorganize the U.S. Agency for International Development and potentially merge much of it into the State Department. Hours earlier, Musk's Department of Government Efficiency sought to exert control over USAID and shut its headquarters to agency officials. Michael R. Gordon, Ken Thomas and Alexander Ward explain where that leaves the agency.

A: It is unclear how Rubio's promise to work with lawmakers to overhaul USAID would be reconciled with Musk's stated determination to close the agency. In his note to lawmakers, Rubio, who says he is now USAID's acting director, said he asked for a review of the agency's activities and that if some of the agency's bureaus were merged into the State Department, the rest might be abolished.

Trump administration officials have been considering plans to merge the 10,000-person, $40 billion agency into the State Department, which would rein in its autonomy. Democratic lawmakers say that would be illegal without congressional approval, as USAID's existence is in federal statute.

Rubio has already ordered a freeze on most foreign aid as part of a review. He later exempted "core life saving programs" that involve medicine, medical services, food and shelter. The immediate fate of other programs, which include those that support economic development, counterterrorist training, counternarcotics cooperation and efforts to strengthen the rule of law abroad, was left unclear.

Meanwhile, two Democratic senators, Brian Schatz of Hawaii and Chris Van Hollen of Maryland, vowed to place holds on Trump's State Department nominees unless the administration's attack on USAID ends.

Trump's tariff idol, William McKinley, abandoned his own tariff policy.

Trump often cites the 25th president, William McKinley, as an inspiration. The "McKinley Tariffs" were some of the largest hikes in U.S. history, but in his second term, McKinley changed his mind, and argued for more free trade.

South Koreans are hooked on divorce shows — even as fewer marriages are actually ending.

While not wholly taboo in socially conservative South Korea, divorce hasn't been normalized either. That's left a curiosity void to fill for TV shows, online testimonials and social-media creators.
